In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function `wrap_string` in Julia that will add new lines whenever the maximum text width would be exceeded:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        
        wrapped_text *= word * " "
        line_length += length(word) + 1 # for the added space
    end
    
    return chomp(wrapped_text)  # remove trailing newline if any
end
```

Example:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Hello world, this is a long string", text_width=10))
```

This would output:

```
Hello world,
this is a
long string
```
